appendix.title: abbreviations
appendix.abbr:
A.R
Active Reserve Army Reserve Automatic Rifle Accident Report

C.O.D.:
Call of Duty Combat Operations Division
Carrier Onboard Delivery: "the use of aircraft to ferry personnel, mail, supplies, and high-priority cargo, such as replacement parts, from shore bases to an aircraft carrier at sea." (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrier_onboard_delivery, https://www.navy.mil/navydata/fact_display.asp?cid=1100&tid=100&ct=1)
Command Ordnance Depot

D.R.O.: Dining Room Orderly D.S.: Drill Seargent E.M.: Enlisted Military, Enlisted Man, or Enlisted Member
G.I.: An American soldier, "originally a semi-official U.S. Army abbreviation for galvanized iron, used in inventories and supply records. It dates to at least 1907 and is commonly found in records from the First World War. From a 1917 entry in Col. Frank P. Lahmâ€™s World War I Diary, published in 1970... By [WWII], G.I. had acquired the meaning of an enlisted soldier. It was so glossed in a 1939 issue of Bugle Notes: 'G.I., n., An enlisted man'" (http://www.wordorigins.org/index.php/more/310/)
F.M.: Field Marshal J.O.: Junior Officer K.P.: Kitchen Patrol (mess-hall duty) L.R.: Little Rock (Arkansas) Lt.: Lieutenant M.J.P.: Military Judgement Proficiency N.C.O.: Non-commissioned officer O.C.S.: Officer Candidate School Pfc: Private First Class Ptn: Platoon P.X.: Post Exchange Q.M.: Quartermaster Q.M.R.T.C.: Quartermaster Replacement Training Center R.P.: Robert Preston [Phillips] (the author) R.P.P.: Robert Preston Phillips (the author) R.R.: Railroad Sgt.: Sergeant S/Sgt.: Staff Sergeant T/4: Technician Fourth Grade T/5: Technician Fifth Grade U.S.A.T.: United States Army Transport V.O.: ?
